data.text:
Google just released our strides towards AI for Social Good emphasizing on new initiatives with United Nations Sustainability Development Goals! In Google's AI Sprinters report, four key strategies are highlighted to leverage AI for growth and development: â­ï¸ Cloud-First Policies: Encourage full adoption to facilitate secure, scalable AI deployment. â­ï¸ National AI Skill Initiatives: Equip workers with AI knowledge to boost productivity. â­ï¸ Data System Modernization: Ensure diverse, quality data sets for effective local AI training. â­ï¸ AI-Enabling Regulation: Create frameworks that balance innovation with responsible AI use. Check out the full report below which is a detailed roadmap for emerging markets to take advantage of the AI opportunity and build robust frameworks to boost AI skills, establish regulation and modernize existing systems to take advantage of cloud computing. The level of detail and commitment is truly extraordinary! What are the most exciting initiatives you found from the report? Share your thoughts on the comments ğŸ˜Š

.: Is the "Google it" era crumbling? Perplexity, the "AI-powered Swiss Army Knife for information discovery and curiosity", recently raised $73.6M at a $520M valuation, bringing total funding to over $100M. Jeff Bezos, the founder of @Amazon and one of the richest people in the world, is one of the investors participating in Perplexity AI's latest $73.6 million funding round. Founded in 2022, Perplexity competes with search giants like Google and Microsoft by trying to reinvent AI search from the ground up. If tools like Perplexity succeed, will the era of "Googling" crumble as students increasingly use AI engines instead? With all that said, AI-powered search drove @Microsoft's Bing Chat - now rebranded as Co-pilot - but only has about 3% of the search market, while Google maintains a hold on a chunky 90% slice. Google developed a Labs experiment called Search Generative Experience (SGE), which uses AI-generated summaries, sources, and follow-up questions to enhance search results. But I have yet to get access. All of this got me thinking about not only my information-searching habits but also how we might see students slowly turn away from Google's page of links. What do you think? Have your search habits changed? https://lnkd.in/egCtK5A2 #ai #aiforeducation #promptcraft .: :. Are you keen for more? Elevate your AI literacy with Promptcraft, my AI-focused newsletter for education. Start your week ahead of the curve with the latest prompt techniques, AI news and updates, learning resources and much more. Try it now âœ https://lnkd.in/egSdtbNt :. .:
